feed.title: Pawn (chess piece) | Breaking bitcoin by playing chess

entry.title: Pawn (chess piece) | Breaking bitcoin by playing chess
entry.summary: The email discusses the frivolous use of block space and emphasizes that it is not encouraged. The email is signed by Lord His Excellency James HRMH of Hougun Manor & Glencoe & British Empire, along with Mr. Damian A. James Williamson from Willtech. The email contains links to various websites, including willtech.com.au, go-overt.com, and duigco.org. The email also includes contact information for the sender. The email concludes by stating that it does not constitute general advice and should be disregarded if misdelivered.The email itself references a GitHub link that provides information on a project involving playing chess using Bitcoin transactions. The project's primary goal is to test Bitcoin transactions, but its secondary goal is to contribute to increasing demand for block space while having fun. The email notes that zero fee transactions no longer work and that all transactions must pay fees that are required long term. The email suggests that chess could be replaced with any two-player game that can be played over a few hours or days. The email ends with the senderâ€™s signature and contact information.
